article:
# Recipe: Oven Baked Garlic Herb Potatoes

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
Oven Baked Garlic Herb Potatoes are a delicious and versatile side dish that pairs well with a variety of main courses. These potatoes are seasoned with a flavorful blend of garlic, herbs, and olive oil, then baked to perfection. They are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, making them a crowd-pleasing addition to any meal.

## Ingredients
- 2 pounds (900g) baby potatoes, halved
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Baking sheet
- Mixing bowl
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Measuring spoons

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 30 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
3. Add the halved baby potatoes to the bowl and toss until they are evenly coated with the herb mixture.
4. Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
5. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy on the outside, and tender on the inside.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the potatoes cool for a few minutes before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Oven Baked Garlic Herb Potatoes can be served as a side dish with roasted chicken, grilled steak, or baked fish.
- They also make a great addition to a vegetarian meal, served alongside roasted vegetables and a salad.

## Variations
- For a cheesy twist, sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese over the potatoes during the last 5 minutes of baking.
- Add a kick of spice by tossing in some red pepper flakes or paprika with the herb mixture.
- Experiment with different herbs such as oregano, basil, or parsley to customize the flavor profile.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to evenly coat the potatoes with the herb mixture to ensure maximum flavor.
- For extra crispy potatoes, increase the oven temperature to 425°F (220°C) and bake for a few minutes longer.
- If you don't have baby potatoes, you can use larger potatoes cut into bite-sized pieces.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1/4 of the recipe
- Calories: 200
- Total Fat: 8g
- Saturated Fat: 1g
- Sodium: 600mg
- Total Carbohydrate: 28g
- Dietary Fiber: 3g
- Sugars: 2g
- Protein: 4g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, place the potatoes on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 10 minutes, or until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Q: Can I use other types of potatoes instead of baby potatoes?
  - A: Yes, you can use larger potatoes cut into bite-sized pieces. Just make sure to adjust the cooking time accordingly.
- Q: Can I use fresh herbs instead of dried herbs?
  - A: Yes, you can substitute dried herbs with fresh herbs. Use three times the amount of fresh herbs called for in the recipe.
- Q: Can I make these potatoes ahead of time?
  - A: While these potatoes are best when served immediately after baking, you can prepare them ahead of time and reheat them in the oven before serving.
